org.ndnx.ndn.impl.repo
Class RepositoryFlowControl

java.lang.Object
  org.ndnx.ndn.impl.NDNFlowControl
      org.ndnx.ndn.impl.repo.RepositoryFlowControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
NDNContentHandler, NDNInterestHandler
public class RepositoryFlowControl
extends NDNFlowControl
implements NDNContentHandler

Handle repo specialty start/end protocol Needs to be able to handle multiple clients. Currently due to limitations in close, to do this requires that clients above close their streams in order when multiple streams are using the same FC.

See Also:
NDNFlowControl, RepositoryInterestHandler

RepositoryFlowControl

public RepositoryFlowControl(NDNHandle handle,
                             boolean local)
                      throws IOException
constructor to allow the repo flow controller to set the scope for the start write interest

Parameters:
handle - a NDNHandle - if null, one is created
local - boolean to determine if a general start write, or one with the scope set to one. A scope set to one will limit the write to a repo on the local device
Throws:
IOException

Method Detail

handleContent

public Interest handleContent(ContentObject co,
                              Interest interest)
Handles packets received from the repository after the start write request. It's looking for a RepoInfo packet indicating a repository has responded.

Specified by:
handleContent in interface NDNContentHandler
Parameters:
co - the ContentObject that matched our Interest
interest - Interest that was satisfied
Returns:
new Interest to be expressed

startWrite

public void startWrite(ContentName name,
                       NDNFlowControl.Shape shape)
                throws IOException
Description copied from class: NDNFlowControl
This is used to indicate that it should start a write for a stream with this name, and should do any stream-specific setup.

Overrides:
startWrite in class NDNFlowControl
shape - currently unused and may be deprecated in the future. Can only be Shape.STREAM
Throws:
IOException - used by subclasses

cancelInterests

public void cancelInterests()
Cancel any outstanding interests on close. TODO - since the flow controller may be used by multiple streams we probably want to use Clients to decide what interests to cancel.
